intro: Afraegle paniculata, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, red-orange inflorescences that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display. The tree is also valued for its rapid growth and ability to provide shade in landscaping.
